PERSONAE.TITLE: Dramatis Personae
PERSONAE.PERSONA: SIWARD, Earl of Northumberland, general of the English forces.
SEYTON, an officer attending on Macbeth.
Lords, Gentlemen, Officers, Soldiers, Murderers, Attendants, and Messengers.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MACBETH
SPEECH.LINE: Into the air; and what seem'd corporal melted
As breath into the wind. Would they had stay'd!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALL
SPEECH.LINE: Fair is foul, and foul is fair:
Hover through the fog and filthy air.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MALCOLM
SPEECH.LINE: Who like a good and hardy soldier fought
Say to the king the knowledge of the broil

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MACBETH
SPEECH.LINE: Stay, you imperfect speakers, tell me more:
By Sinel's death I know I am thane of Glamis;
But how of Cawdor? the thane of Cawdor lives,
A prosperous gentleman; and to be king
Stands not within the prospect of belief,
No more than to be Cawdor. Say from whence
You owe this strange intelligence? or why
Upon this blasted heath you stop our way
With such prophetic greeting? Speak, I charge you.
